install.name: Jumi
install.author: Martin Hajek
install.description:
Jumi content plugin for Joomla! includes into Joomla! articles any file.

In an addition it can pass into the included *.php file any number of argument values.

Usage:

As you write an article just write there this code: {jumi [pathname] [arg1] [arg2] ... [argN]},
where pathname is the file pathname of the file to be included.

The path is a relative one with respect to Default Absolute Path that can be set in the plugin parameters. If not set then is equivalent to Joomla! root.

Arguments [arg1] ... [argN] are optional. It depends on your custom included php file if it can handle them.

Arguments can be accessed by $jumi[] array in an included php file.

Example (included): {jumi [plugin/content/jumi_demo.php][first][second]}

Remark: everything out of the square brackets is ignored; you can use this feature for your comments e.g. {Jumi blablabla [filepathneme] width=[arg1] heighth=[arg2]}

There is also a compatible Jumi module that includes the same files into Joomla! module positions.

Additional resources: Downloads & guides, Tips & tricks.

param.name: default_absolute_path
param.label: Default Absolute Path
param.description: Optional Default Absolute Path to included files. If left blank then it is identical to Joomla! root directory. No slash at the end.

param.name: hide_code
param.label: Hide code
param.description: If set to Yes the Jumi code is not displayed and not processed.
